00109 static cache_inode_gc_policy_t cache_inode_gc_policy ; /*<< the policy to be used by the garbagge collector */
00110 
00131 static int cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( cache_entry_t * pentry, cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00132 {
00133   fsal_handle_t              * pfsal_handle     = NULL ;
00134   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter      = NULL ;
00135   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter_next = NULL ;
00136   cache_inode_fsal_data_t      fsaldata ;
00137   cache_inode_status_t         status ;
00138   fsal_status_t                fsal_status ;
00139   hash_buffer_t                key, old_key, old_value ;
00140   int                          rc ;
00141 
00142 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00143   printf( "(pthread_self=%p): About to remove pentry=%p, type=%d\n", pthread_self(), pentry, pentry->internal_md.type ) ; 
00144 #endif
00145 
00146   /* sanity check */
00147   if ( (pentry->gc_lru_entry != NULL) &&
00148        ( (cache_entry_t *)pentry->gc_lru_entry->buffdata.pdata ) != pentry )
00149   {
00150       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00151                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: LRU entry pointed by this pentry doesn't match the GC LRU" ) ;
00152   }
00153   
00154   /* Get the FSAL handle */
00155   if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry, &status ) ) == NULL )
00156     {
00157       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00158                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: unable to retrieve pentry's specific filesystem info" ) ;
00159       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00160     }
00161   
00162   fsaldata.handle = *pfsal_handle ;
00163 
00164   if( pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00165     fsaldata.cookie = DIR_START ;
00166   else
00167     fsaldata.cookie = pentry->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos ;
00168   
00169   /* Use the handle to build the key */
00170   if( cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( &key, &fsaldata, pgcparam->pclient ) )
00171     {
00172       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00173                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: could not build hashtable key" ) ;
00174 
00175       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00176       
00177       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00178     }
00179   
00180   
00181   /* use the key to delete the entry */
00182   rc = HashTable_Del( pgcparam->ht, &key, &old_key, &old_value );
00183   
00184   if( (rc != HASHTABLE_SUCCESS) && (rc != HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY) )
00185     {
00186       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00187                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: entry could not be deleted, status = %d", rc ) ;
00188 
00189       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00190 
00191       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00192     }
00193   else if ( rc == HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY )
00194     {
00195         DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT,
00196                           "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: entry already deleted, type=%d, status=%d", pentry->internal_md.type, rc ) ;
00197       
00198         cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00199         return LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00200     }
00201 
00202   /* Clean up the associated ressources in the FSAL */
00203   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR(  fsal_status = FSAL_CleanObjectResources( pfsal_handle ) ) )
00204     {
00205        DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00206                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: Could'nt free FSAL ressources fsal_status.major=%u", fsal_status.major ) ;
00207     }
00208      
00209 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC  
00210   printf( "++++> pentry %p deleted from HashTable\n", pentry ) ;
00211 #endif
00212 
00213   /* Release the hash key data */ 
00214   cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &old_key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00215 
00216   /* Sanity check: old_value.pdata is expected to be equal to pentry,
00217    * and is released later in this function */
00218   if ( (cache_entry_t*)old_value.pdata != pentry )
00219   {
00220        DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00221                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: unexpected pdata %p from hash table (pentry=%p)",
00222                           old_value.pdata, pentry ) ;
00223   }
00224     
00225   cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00226 
00227   /* Recover the parent list entries */
00228   parent_iter = pentry->parent_list  ;
00229   while( parent_iter != NULL ) 
00230     {
00231       parent_iter_next = parent_iter->next_parent ;
00232 
00233       RELEASE_PREALLOC( parent_iter, pgcparam->pclient->pool_parent, next_alloc ) ;
00234    
00235       parent_iter = parent_iter_next ;
00236     }
00237   
00238 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00239   printf( "++++> parent directory sent back to pool\n" ) ;
00240 #endif
00241 
00242   /* If entry is a DIR_CONTINUE or a DIR_BEGINNING, release pdir_data */
00243   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00244     {
00245       /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00246       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data, pgcparam->pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
00247     }
00248 
00249   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00250     {
00251       /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00252       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data, pgcparam->pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
00253     }
00254   
00255 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00256   printf( "++++> pdir_data (if needed) sent back to pool\n" ) ;
00257 #endif
00258   
00259   /* Free and Destroy the mutex associated with the pentry */
00260   V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00261   
00262   cache_inode_mutex_destroy( pentry ) ;
00263   
00264   /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00265   RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pgcparam->pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00266   
00267   /* Regular exit */
00268   pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged =  pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged -1 ;
00269 
00270 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00271   printf( "++++> pentry %p: clean entry is ok\n", pentry )  ;
00272 #endif  
00273 
00274   return LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ; /* Cleaning ok */
00275 }
00276 
00289 static int cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent(  cache_entry_t * pentry, cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00290 {
00291   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter    = NULL ;
00292   
00293 
00294   /* Set the cache status as INVALID in the directory entries */
00295   for( parent_iter = pentry->parent_list ; parent_iter != NULL ; parent_iter = parent_iter->next_parent )
00296     {
00297       if( parent_iter->parent == NULL )
00298         {
00299            DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG,
00300                               "cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent: pentry %p has no parent, no dirent to be removed...", pentry ) ;
00301             continue ;
00302         } 
00303       
00304       /* If I reached this point, then parent_iter->parent is not null and is a valid cache_inode pentry */
00305       P_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00306       
00307       /* Check for type of the parent */
00308       if( parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING && 
00309           parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00310         {
00311           V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00312           /* Major parent incoherency: parent is no directory */
00313           DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00314                              "cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent: major inconcistency. Found an entry whose parent is not a directory" ) ;
00315           return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00316         }
00317       
00318       /* Set the entry as invalid in the dirent array */
00319       if( parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00320         {
00321           if( parent_iter->subdirpos > CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
00322             {
00323                 V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00324                 DisplayLog( "A known bug occured line %d file %s: pentry=%p type=%u parent_iter->subdirpos=%d, should never exceed %d, entry not removed", 
00325                             __LINE__, __FILE__, pentry, pentry->internal_md.type, parent_iter->subdirpos, CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) ;
00326                 return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00327             }
00328           else
00329            {
00330               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[parent_iter->subdirpos].active = INVALID ;
00331               /* Garbagge invalidates the effet of the readdir previously made */
00332               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir = CACHE_INODE_NO ;
00333               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.nbactive -= 1 ;
00334            }
00335         }
00336       else
00337         {
00338           if( parent_iter->subdirpos > CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
00339             {
00340                 V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00341                 DisplayLog( "A known bug occured line %d file %s: pentry=%p type=%u parent_iter->subdirpos=%d, should never exceed %d, entry not removed",
00342                             __LINE__, __FILE__, pentry, pentry->internal_md.type, parent_iter->subdirpos, CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) ;
00343                 return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00344             }
00345           else
00346             {
00347                parent_iter->parent->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[parent_iter->subdirpos].active = INVALID ;
00348                parent_iter->parent->object.dir_cont.nbactive -= 1 ;
00349             }
00350         }
00351       
00352 
00353       V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00354     }
00355 
00356   
00357   return  LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00358 } /* cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent */
00359 
00374 int cache_inode_gc_suppress_file( cache_entry_t * pentry, cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00375 {
00376   P_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00377 
00378   DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00379                      "Entry %p (REGULAR_FILE/SYMBOLIC_LINK) will be garbagged" ) ;
00380 
00381   /* Set the entry as invalid */
00382   pentry->internal_md.valid_state = INVALID ;
00383 
00384 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00385   printf( "****> cache_inode_gc_suppress_file on %p\n", pentry ) ;
00386 #endif
00387 
00388   /* Remove refences in the parent entries */
00389   if( cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00390    { 
00391       V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00392       return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00393    }
00394 
00395   /* Clean the entry */
00396   if( cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00397     return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00398 
00399   /* Mutex has already been freed at destruction time */
00400 
00401   return  LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00402 } /* cache_inode_gc_suppress_file */
00403 
00418 int cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory( cache_entry_t * pentry,  cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00419 {
00420   cache_entry_t * pentry_iter      = NULL ;
00421   cache_entry_t * pentry_iter_save = NULL ;
00422   
00423   P_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00424   pentry->internal_md.valid_state = INVALID ;
00425   
00426   if( cache_inode_is_dir_empty( pentry ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00427     {
00428       V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00429 
00430       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00431                          "Entry %p (DIR_BEGINNING) is not empty. The dir_chain will not be garbagged now", pentry ) ;
00432       
00433       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ; /* entry is not to be suppressed */
00434     }
00435 
00436   /* If we reached this point, the directory contains no active entry, it should be removed from the cache */
00437   DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00438                      "Entry %p (DIR_BEGINNING) and its associated dir_chain will be garbagged", pentry ) ;
00439   
00440 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00441   printf( "****> cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory on %p\n", pentry ) ;
00442 #endif
00443 
00444   /* Remove refences in the parent entries */
00445   if( cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00446     {
00447       V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00448       return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00449     }
00450 
00451   /* Remove the whole dir_chain from the cache */
00452   pentry_iter = pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ; 
00453   while( pentry_iter != NULL ) 
00454     {
00455       pentry_iter_save = pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00456       
00457       if( cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( pentry_iter, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00458         {
00459           V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00460           return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00461         }
00462       
00463       pentry_iter = pentry_iter_save ;
00464     }   
00465 
00466   if( cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00467     {
00468       V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00469       return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00470     }
00471       
00472   /* Mutex has already been freed at destruction time */
00473     
00474   return LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00475 } /* cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory */
00476 
00492 int cache_inode_gc_function( LRU_entry_t * plru_entry, void * addparam )
00493 {
00494   time_t                   entry_time   = 0  ;
00495   time_t                   current_time = time( NULL ) ;
00496   cache_entry_t          * pentry       = NULL ;
00497   cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam     = (cache_inode_param_gc_t *)addparam ;
00498   
00499   time_t allocated;
00500   
00501   /* Get the entry */
00502   pentry = (cache_entry_t *)(plru_entry->buffdata.pdata) ;
00503 
00504   /* Get the entry time (the larger value in read_time and mod_time ) */
00505   if( pentry->internal_md.read_time > pentry->internal_md.mod_time )
00506     entry_time = pentry->internal_md.read_time ;
00507   else
00508     entry_time = pentry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00509 
00510   
00511   allocated = pentry->internal_md.alloc_time;
00512    
00513   if( pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged != 0 )
00514     {
00515       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00516                          "We still need %d entries to be garbagged", pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged  ) ;
00517       
00518       /* Should we get ride of this entry ? */
00519       if( ( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ) &&
00520           ( cache_inode_gc_policy.directory_expiration_delay > 0 )  )
00521         {
00522           if( current_time - entry_time > cache_inode_gc_policy.directory_expiration_delay )
00523             {
00524               /* Entry should be tagged invalid */
00525               DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00526                                  "----->>>>>>>> DIR GC : Garbagge collection on dir entry %p", pentry ) ;
00527               return cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory( pentry, pgcparam ) ;
00528             }
00529           else
00530             DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "No garbagge on dir entry %p used:%d allocated:%d %d", 
00531                                pentry,  current_time - entry_time, current_time - allocated, cache_inode_gc_policy.directory_expiration_delay ) ;
00532         }
00533       else if( ( pentry->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE ||  pentry->internal_md.type == SYMBOLIC_LINK ) &&
00534                ( cache_inode_gc_policy.file_expiration_delay > 0 ) )
00535         {
00536           if( current_time - entry_time > cache_inode_gc_policy.file_expiration_delay )
00537             {
00538               /* Entry should be suppress and tagged invalid */
00539               DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00540                                  "----->>>>>> REGULAR/SYMLINK GC : Garbagge collection on regular/symlink entry %p", 
00541                                  pentry ) ;
00542               return cache_inode_gc_suppress_file( pentry, pgcparam ) ;
00543             }
00544           else
00545             DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "No garbagge on regular/symlink entry %p used:%d allocated:%d %d", 
00546                                pentry, current_time - entry_time, current_time - allocated, cache_inode_gc_policy.file_expiration_delay ) ;
00547         }
00548     }
00549   
00550   /* Default return, entry is not to be set invalid */
00551   return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00552 } /* cache_inode_gc_function */
00553 
00554 /* @} */
00555 
00573 void cache_inode_set_gc_policy( cache_inode_gc_policy_t policy )
00574 {
00575   cache_inode_gc_policy = policy ;
00576 } /* cache_inode_set_gc_policy */
00577 
00578 
00586 cache_inode_gc_policy_t cache_inode_get_gc_policy( void )
00587 {
00588   return cache_inode_gc_policy ;
00589 } /* cache_inode_get_gc_policy */
00590 
00609 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_gc( hash_table_t             * ht,
00610                                      cache_inode_client_t     * pclient,
00611                                      cache_inode_status_t     * pstatus)
00612 {
00613   cache_inode_param_gc_t gcparam ;
00614   unsigned int           hash_size ;
00615   unsigned int           invalid_before_gc = 0 ;
00616   unsigned int           invalid_after_gc  = 0 ;
00617  
00618   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00619   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00620 
00621   /* Is this time to gc ? */
00622   if( pclient->call_since_last_gc <  cache_inode_gc_policy.nb_call_before_gc )
00623     return *pstatus ;
00624   
00625   if( time( NULL ) - pclient->time_of_last_gc < (int)(cache_inode_gc_policy.run_interval) )
00626     return *pstatus ;
00627   
00628   /* Actual GC will be made */
00629   pclient->call_since_last_gc = 0 ;
00630   pclient->time_of_last_gc = time( NULL ) ;
00631 
00632   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "Checking if garbagge collection is needed" ) ;
00633                      
00634   /* 1st ; we get the hash table size to see if garbagge is required */
00635   hash_size = HashTable_GetSize( ht ) ;
00636 
00637 
00638   if( hash_size > cache_inode_gc_policy.hwmark_nb_entries )
00639     {
00640       /*
00641        * Garbagge collection is made in several steps
00642        *    1- Set the oldest entry as invalid and garbagge their contents
00643        *    2- Free the invalid entry in the LRU
00644        *         
00645        *    Behaviour: - A DIR_BEGINNING is garbagged with all its DIR_CONTINUE associated
00646        *               - A directory is garbagged when all its entries are garbagged
00647        *
00648        */
00649       
00650       gcparam.ht              = ht ;
00651       gcparam.pclient         = pclient ;
00652       gcparam.nb_to_be_purged = hash_size - cache_inode_gc_policy.lwmark_nb_entries ; /* try to purge until lw mark is reached */
00653       
00654       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "Garbagge collection started (to be purged=%u, LRU size=%u)",
00655               pclient->lru_gc->nb_entry, gcparam.nb_to_be_purged ) ;
00656      
00657       invalid_before_gc = pclient->lru_gc->nb_invalid ; 
00658       if( LRU_invalidate_by_function( pclient->lru_gc, cache_inode_gc_function, (void *)&gcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00659         {
00660           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00661           return *pstatus ;
00662         }
00663       
00664       invalid_after_gc = pclient->lru_gc->nb_invalid ; 
00665 
00666       /* Removes the LRU entries and put them back to the pool */
00667       if( LRU_gc_invalid( pclient->lru_gc, NULL ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00668         {
00669           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00670           return *pstatus ;
00671         }
00672 
00673       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "Garbagge collection finished, %u entries removed", invalid_after_gc - invalid_before_gc ) ;
00674 
00675       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00676     }
00677   else
00678     {
00679       /* no garbagge is required, just gets ride of the invalid in tyhe LRU list */
00680       /* Removes the LRU entries and put them back to the pool */
00681       if( LRU_gc_invalid( pclient->lru_gc, NULL ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00682         {
00683           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00684           return *pstatus ;
00685         }
00686       else
00687         *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00688     }
00689 
00690   return *pstatus ;
00691 } /* cache_inode_gc */
00692 
00693 /* @} */
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:28 2009 for Cache inode layer by  1.5.7.1
